title: News regarding OmniCorp Global
story_body:
OmniCorp Global Names New Regional Sales Director for Southeast Markets

OmniCorp Global (NYSE: OMNI) announced today the appointment of Jennifer Martinez as Regional Sales Director for Southeast Markets, effective November 1. Martinez will oversee sales operations across Florida, Georgia, and the Carolinas, reporting directly to Vice President of North American Sales, David Chen.

Martinez joins OmniCorp from TechSolutions Inc., where she served as Senior Sales Manager for five years. She brings over 15 years of experience in B2B software sales and channel development to her new role.

"Jennifer's track record of building strong client relationships and developing high-performing teams aligns well with our growth objectives in the Southeast region," said Chen in a company statement. "We look forward to her contributions as we continue expanding our presence in these key markets."

The appointment comes as OmniCorp seeks to strengthen its regional sales infrastructure following a 3.2% increase in Southeast market revenue during the third quarter. The company has been gradually expanding its sales force across North America as part of its 2024 strategic plan.

In related news, OmniCorp will participate in the upcoming Digital Enterprise Summit in Atlanta, scheduled for November 15-17. The company will showcase its latest enterprise software solutions at booth 1247 and host a panel discussion on cloud migration strategies for mid-market businesses.

Additionally, OmniCorp announced the launch of its "Green Office Initiative," a pilot program aimed at reducing paper consumption across its corporate offices by 25% over the next 18 months. The initiative includes transitioning to digital documentation systems and implementing print management software at five major office locations.

The program represents a modest step in OmniCorp's broader environmental commitments outlined in its 2023 sustainability report. The company estimates the initiative could save approximately 2.5 million sheets of paper annually once fully implemented.

OmniCorp Global provides enterprise software solutions and IT consulting services to businesses across North America. The company reported revenues of $4.7 billion in fiscal year 2023.
